pullRequest.body:
This linter is intended to work much like `minImports` in helping with splitting files. It places a warning on each set of declarations that could be moved to an earlier file. It takes into account dependencies on declarations in the current file, so that a whole block of declarations can be moved even if there are dependencies between the declarations in the block.

Since definitions are often deliberately placed in their own file, this linter does not place a warning on any declaration depending on a definition in the current file.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [3ebee38c70](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18702/commits/3ebee38c7091f6abe87258cee4949c86dcfadfd2)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Tactic.Linter | 25 | 30 | +5 (+20.00%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4623 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 195783 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

</details>

---

`+ Lean.Environment.localDefDependencies`
`+ Lean.Name.isLocal`
`+ def_with_multiple_dependencies`
`+ getAllDependencies`
`+ propose_to_move_this_def`
`+ propose_to_move_this_theorem`
`+ theorem_with_local_def`
`+ upstreamableDeclLinter`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>
maintainer delegate
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by adomani.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by adomani.
I have done some cleanup and I think this is good to go!
One more comment: the linter is called `upstreamableDecl`, but the PR title uses `upstreamDecl`.  I may actually have a slight preference for `upstreamDecl` as the name of the linter as well.
@Vierkantor, could you address @adomani's remaining suggestions, and then merge?
bors d+

:v: adomani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I think that Kim meant

bors delegate=Vierkantor

ðŸ˜Š

:v: Vierkantor can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11891354195/job/33131930634)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11891354195/job/33131930956)

Thank you very much for the improvements!

I only left a few small suggestions, but I am happy with this!

I am a bit hesitant to maintainer merge this, since I was very involved in the initial development, but I think that this is very useful!

```suggestion
```
This is essentially contained in the previous module doc, right?

```suggestion
          logWarningAt id f!"Consider moving this declaration to the module {upstream}."
```
What do you think of this?

Also, since this is a linter, you may prefer to use `Linter.logLint linter.upstreamableDecl id ...`.

In `ImportGraph` there is [GoToModuleLink](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/ImportGraph/Imports.html#GoToModuleLink) that `#find_home` uses to get a clickable link for a module: maybe we can use this here as well for `upstream`.

I used the `logLint` and the widget, thanks for teaching me that! One thing though, looks like neovim doesn't render this widget specially (I think they need to manually implement support for each widget). Could you check that it works okay in VS Code?

I just checked in VSCode and it works great: the module name is clickable (and clearly identifiable as a link) and clicking on it opens the corresponding module.

Thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: the upstreamDecl linter
